• This amazing picture shows the reason why we named our project PILI! • 
What you can see here is two bacteria exchanging genetic material through their pilus (one pilus, two pili). This hairlike structure forms a bridge between the two bacteria cells so that DNA and other molecules can passe from one cell to another in an act of sharing, even of learning, one could say. At PILI we want to create a durable bridge between the microbial and the human world, and through this powerful partnership, changing the ways we produce colors. •
